Decentralized & Open Source

Decentralized
Tor Tunneling

Self-hosted tunneling that uses Tor hidden services and P2P networking. Register domains like byronwade.local that work both locally (127.0.0.1) and globally (Tor .onion) - same domain, everywhere.

npx @byronwade/beam 3000 --tor

How Decentralized Tunneling Works

No central servers. No accounts. Just you, Tor, and the P2P network.

One Domain, Two Worlds

The same domain name works everywhere, automatically

byronwade.local

Webhooks, APIs, and external services automatically resolve to Tor

Decentralized by Design

Every feature is built around the principles of decentralization, privacy, and user sovereignty.

Smart Domain Resolution

One domain name works everywhere. byronwade.local resolves to localhost locally, Tor .onion globally. Context-aware DNS magic.

Tor Hidden Services

Your local apps become globally accessible through Tor .onion addresses. No central servers, no IP leaks, military-grade anonymity.

P2P Domain Registry

Decentralized domain name system using Kademlia DHT. Register domains across the peer network with cryptographic signatures.

End-to-End Encryption

All traffic is encrypted from your machine through Tor to the destination. No man-in-the-middle attacks possible.

Self-Sovereign Identity

No accounts, no logins, no data collection. You own your tunnels and your data completely. Pure peer-to-peer.

Local-First Architecture

Everything runs on your machine. SQLite database for configuration, no cloud dependencies, complete data sovereignty.

Take Back Control

Stop relying on centralized tunneling services. Own your connections, own your data. Use your own domain names everywhere.

npx @byronwade/beam 3000 --tor

No accounts ‚Ä¢ No tracking ‚Ä¢ No middlemen ‚Ä¢ Just decentralized tunneling
